scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has been included in a national catalogue from a Member State whose NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.
statement:
ADMS is included in the national catalogue of Slovakia. The National Interoperability Framework (NIF) of this Member State is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the European Interoperability Framework (EIF) according to the National Interoperability Framework Observatory (NIFO) factsheets. 

Slovakia’s Catalogue:
http://www.informatizacia.sk/standardy-is-vs/596s

NIFO factsheets:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/national-interoperability-framework-observatory-nifo/nifo-factsheets

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification facilitates the publication of public data as open data.
statement:
ADMS is an RDF vocabulary for representing concepts of a repository, intended to facilitate the co-operation. By describing the assets, releases, and distributions of a repository, it fosters the publications of data and its discoverability. _x000D_In fact, ADMS is the basis for the ADMS-AP used in Joinup to describe the different reusable solutions and make them better discoverable and reusable across borders. _x000D_
_x000D_
ADMS in Joinup:_x000D_
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/semantic-interoperability-community-semic/adms

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: All stakeholders have the opportunity to contribute to the development of the specification
statement:
W3C has a defined and publicly available Process for the Development and approval process of the specification as a recommended standard. Also, a clear Release Notes tracking the changes of the different versions is archived. 
             
W3C Process document:
https://www.w3.org/2018/Process-20180201/#Policies

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: A public review is part of the decision-making process.
statement:
W3C has a defined and publicly available Process for the Development and approval process of the specification as a recommended standard, including a public review.

W3C Process document:
https://www.w3.org/2018/Process-20180201/#Policies

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is available for everyone to study.
statement:
ADMS is publicly available for implementation and study for free on W3C's webpage. 

ADMS Specification W3C:
https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-adms/

ADMS in Joinup:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/asset-description-metadata-schema-adms/about

criterion_description: The specification is licensed on a (F)RAND basis
statement:
The W3C Royalty-Free IPR licenses granted under the W3C Patent Policy apply to all W3C specifications, including ADMS.

W3C Patent practice:
https://www.w3.org/TR/patent-practice#ref-AC

The W3C Royalty-Free IPR licenses granted under the W3C Patent Policy apply to all W3C specifications, including ADMS.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is sufficiently mature for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
The specification was developed in 2012 and has been implemented at European level, and it has been evolved together with the application profile used in the European Platform for the reusability of interoperability Solutions, Joinup. 

ADMS in Joinup:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/asset-description-metadata-schema-adms/about

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has sufficient market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
The specification is currently implemented in several initiatives in the public sector. This is a key point that reflects the market acceptance of the specification by the public administrations and institutions in Europe. 
Some implementations of the ADMS are Metadata Registry (MDR), ADMS-enabled description of a vocabulary implemented in PoolParty Thesaurus Manager 3.1.0, and the Implementation for the XRepository of the German Federal Ministry of the interior. 

ADMS in Joinup:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/asset-description-metadata-schema-adms/about

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the creation of innovative solutions.
statement: Even though at the moment of elaborating the assessment the specification is used in the context of the cross-border reusability of interoperability solutions, the specification in itself is used to describe these solutions in a repository. Therefore, ADMS does not foster the creation of innovative solutions.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has a strong support from at least one developer community.
statement:
ADMS was developed and it is maintained by W3C which is an international community developing open standards.

ADMS in W3C:
https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-adms/

ADMS in Joinup:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/asset-description-metadata-schema-adms/about

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the visibility of administrative rules, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
statement:
By using ADMS to describe assets/solutions, the administrations ensure and enhance the visibility of these solutions and assets that are involved in the development of EU administrations’ activity. 

ADMS on Joinup:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/asset-description-metadata-schema-adms/about

ADMS Specification W3C:
https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-adms/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the comprehensibility of administrative rules, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
statement:
ADMS provides a standardised method for describing assets and their distributions. Therefore, while providing a common way and components for the metadata provision, it helps the comprehensibility of data and services of Public administrations across borders.

ADMS on Joinup:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/asset-description-metadata-schema-adms/about

ADMS Specification W3C:
https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-adms/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification helps to ensure the availability of interfaces with internal information systems of a public administration.
statement:
ADMS does not directly help with the provision of application programming interfaces (APIs) or Web services. However, the specification allows to provide a standardised description for assets in a repository. As well, it allows the discoverability of resources from a single access point. An example of this is the European platform, Joinup. 

ADMS on Joinup:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/asset-description-metadata-schema-adms/about

ADMS Specification W3C:
https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-adms/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is reusable beyond the domain for which it was originally developed.
statement:
Although ADMS was developed taking into account the perspective of the eGovernment System Development, it is a vocabulary that could be reused beyond this domain. It aims to ease the standardisation of assets description in assets repositories, to enhance the discoverability and reuse of assets and solutions. 

ADMS Specification W3C:
https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-adms/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has been made available for its reuse by the organisations, administrations, open communities, etc. that developed it.
statement:
ADMS is publicly available for implementation and use for free on W3C's webpage. Therefore, it can be reused by the organisations, administrations, open communities, etc. that developed it.

ADMS on Joinup:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/asset-description-metadata-schema-adms/about

ADMS Specification W3C:
https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-adms/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is available for free on at least one national or European platform.
statement:
ADMS can be found for free along within the European Collaborative Platform, Joinup.

ADMS on Joinup:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/asset-description-metadata-schema-adms/about

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is independent of any specific technology and/or platform.
statement:
Like other vocabularies, ADMS reuses components from other vocabularies. (e.g. foaf, dcat), and also the resource Description Framework (RDF). This causes a dependency that can hamper the interoperability in those cases where new releases of the reused vocabularies are not backward compatible. 

ADMS Specification W3C:
https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-adms/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is proportionate to the needs of its users (citizens, businesses or administrations).
statement:
ADMS, as a vocabulary, can be implemented and reused independently of the amounts of data without hampering the scalability or the interoperability of systems. The reuse of the specification for the description of Interoperability Solutions or assets would ease and enhance the interoperability. 

ADMS Specification W3C:
https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-adms/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters data portability between systems and applications supporting the implementation and evolution of European public services when legally possible.
statement:
ADMS supports the evolution of European Public Services by enhancing the discoverability and reuse of interoperability solutions. 

ADMS on Joinup:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/asset-description-metadata-schema-adms/about

ADMS Specification W3C:
https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-adms/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification eases the implementation of the once-only principle.
statement:
ADMS’s purpose is the description of Assets within a Catalogue (repository), making them easy to discover and reuse. However, it is not related to foster the one-only principle between administrations and stakeholders.

ADMS Specification W3C:
https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-adms/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters e-accessibility.
statement:
The purpose of ADMS is not related to e-accessibility. Therefore, this criterion is considered not applicable to this specification.

ADMS Specification W3C:
https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-adms/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the secure and trustworthy data exchange between citizens and businesses, and public administrations.
statement:
As a vocabulary to describe assets within a Repository, it provides concepts and properties identifying the content creators and other informative metadata such as dates involved in the release of the solutions described. These facts increase the reliability of the exchanged data. _x000D_
_x000D_
ADMS Specification W3C:_x000D_
https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-adms/

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the delivery of multilingual European public services.
statement:
The purpose of ADMS is not related to the delivery of multilingual public services. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to this specification. 

ADMS Specification W3C:
https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-adms/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The adoption of the specification reduces the administrative burden.
statement:
ADMS helps to search, identify, retrieve, compare semantic assets to be reused by public administrations, it can help to reduce the administrative burden related to the development and design of solutions. 

ADMS on Joinup:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/asset-description-metadata-schema-adms/about

ADMS Specification W3C:
https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-adms/

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the long-term preservation of electronic records and other kinds of information.
statement:
Although ADMS’s purpose is not the long-term preservations, it can be used to document and store semantic assets. 

ADMS on Joinup:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/asset-description-metadata-schema-adms/about

ADMS Specification W3C:
https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-adms/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: There are already existing studies or documentation assessing the specification in terms of effectiveness and efficiency.
statement: After having researched the effectiveness and efficiency of the ADMS, no study or documentation assessing the specification in terms of effectiveness and efficiency has been found to justify this criterion.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification can be mapped to the European Interoperability Reference Architecture (EIRA).
statement:
ADMS is already associated with EIRA ABBs in the European Library Of Specifications (ELIS). More specifically, ADMS can define the interoperability aspects of the "Data" ABB from the Semantic View, and "Metadata Management Component”, “Metadata Management Service”, “Data Publication Component”, and “Data Publication Service” ABBs of the EIRA Technical View.

EIRA Library of Interoperability Specifications (ELIS):
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/elis/release/v100

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: Mechanisms to assess conformity of the implementations of the specification (e.g. conformity tests, certifications) are available for free.
statement: After searching for a certification or conformity test to validate ADMS no tool has been found that assess the conformity of the specification.

Slovakia is recommending ADMS in its ICT National Catalogues. 

Slovakia’s Catalogue:
http://www.informatizacia.sk/standardy-is-vs/596s

CAMSS List of standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has been selected for its use in an EU cross-border project or initiative after agreed identification and assessment.

ADMS is used as the basis for the ADMS-AP, which is the backbone of the European cross-border platform for the reuse of interoperability solutions Joinup. 

ADMS on Joinup:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/asset-description-metadata-schema-adms/about

The specification is included in Slovakia’s catalogue of recommended specifications. 

Slovakia’s Catalogue:
http://www.informatizacia.sk/standardy-is-vs/596s

CAMSS List of standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is included in a catalogue of standards at EU level.
statement:
After checking the different standard catalogues at supra-national level, there is no evidence of the inclusion of ADMS within any European catalogue of standards.

ICT technical specifications:
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en

CEN search tool catalogue:
https://standards.cen.eu/dyn/www/f?p=CENWEB:105::RESET::::

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is included in an interoperability agreement established between organisations involved in European public service provision.
statement:
ADMS is being used as the basis of the European Platform for sharing and reuse Interoperability Solutions Joinup. It is done by an application profile developed to address the specific requirements of the platforms and stakeholder. The ADMS-AP is the schema used for the description of the assets included in Joinup, aiming to increase the cooperation between participants. 

ADMS on Joinup:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/asset-description-metadata-schema-adms/about

ADMS Specification W3C:
https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-adms/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is compliant with a European standardisation regulation (e.g. regulation 1025/2012 on European standardisation).
statement:
After checking the assessments performed by CAMSS and the list of specifications identified by the MSP Multi-stakeholder-platform, no assessment verifying the compliance of the specification with the European standardisation regulation has been found.

ICT technical specifications:
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is a commonly accepted business process modelling specification.
statement:
The purpose of ADMS is not related to the modelling of business processes. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification. 

ADMS Specification W3C:
https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-adms/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification defines organisational interoperability aspects (e.g. skills, language, etc.).
statement:
The purpose of ADMS is not related to organisational interoperability. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification defines a cross-sector reusable data model.
statement:
ADMS, as a vocabulary for the description of assets included within a Repository (Catalogue), it can be used to define Interoperability Solutions catalogues, beyond the eGovernement scope.

ADMS Specification W3C:

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the publication of data as Linked Open Data.
statement:
ADMS is a vocabulary based on DCAT for the description of Assets, specifically interoperability solutions). In this sense, the ADMS helps the publication and reusability of solutions and their data.
